Series.Actors: | Steve Blum|Elan Garfias|Jason Marsden|Lacey Chabert|Maurice LaMarche|Parvesh Cheena|Shannon McKain|
Series.Overview: Meet the Rescue Bots! Chase, Heatwave, Blades, and Boulder are given a very important mission by Optimus Prime: Protect and learn about mankind. Stationed undercover on a technologically advanced island, they team up with a family of first responders, including a police chief, fire fighter, helicopter pilot, and engineer. With help from Cody, the family's youngest, the Rescue Bots keep the peace and keep people safe in their new home. And along the way, they learn what it really means to be a hero.

Episode.Overview: The four members of Rescue Force Sigma-17 emerge and are greeted by the Autobot leader Optimus Prime, who assigns them to work with the Burns family on an island. While the four are supposed to respond to every command the humans give them, they get fed up with it and are tempted to leave Earth. Until, an animatronic dinosaur attacks the island.

While Chase and Chief Burns pursue an out-of-control robo-landscaper through Griffin Rock, Cody Burns reports that the rest of the team might be delayed, as his siblings are having trouble coming to terms with the fact that their rescue vehicles are alien robots. A volcano suddenly threatens the island of Griffin Rock, sending the Rescue Bots and Burns family into action. The group has to put aside their differences and work together in order to save the island.
Craving adventure, Dani gives Blades a new scoop claw, but they soon find themselves in harm's way
Flying lobsters invade a summer festival, and an angry Heatwave refuses to help fight them.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Alien Invasion of Griffin Rock
Episode.Overview: The Rescue Bots are put in danger when a resident of Griffin Rock threatens to expose the secret of an "alien invasion."

Boulder learns about humans and their domesticated friends, and decides that the Rescue Bots needs an animal mascot, too. But, he and Blades quickly learn that a zoo probably wasn't the best place to go pet shopping...

An impatient Cody wants to super-charge his new go-kart so he can be an on-site part of all the rescues. But in the process, Cody unleashes a swarm of high-tech, futuristic nanites, jeopardizing the town and sending Boulder on a rampage!

The Bots become unlikely babysitters when Cody enlists their help to take care of Doc Greene's new prototype: a lifelike Robo-Baby. Our Rescue Bots discover that protecting an entire town is a cakewalk compared to just containing one mischievous infant.
Cody, his family and the Rescue Bots have to stop a snow storm in July when a weather machine goes haywire.
A shark targeting high-tech ocean equipment is spotted off the Griffin Rock shore.
An intruder hacks into Griffin Rock's central computer and wreaks havoc
A scientist tries to replace the team with a new invention, leaving everyone out of the action.
Cody looks for proof that the new scientist's invention is really a villainous plan.
The Rescue Bots are accidentally shrunk and the Burns family must work without their partners.
Cody finds a clue to an old mystery and makes a startling underwater discovery.
The Rescue Bots disobey the Chief's orders and find themselves in a life-threatening situation.
A storm strands Cody on a deserted island where they find a pirate ship that holds the key to a mystery.
Bumblebee pays the Rescue Bots a visit just in time to help investigate a mysterious meteor.
The Bots and Burns must stop a giant glob of space slime before it consumes the town.
Cody and the Rescue Bots try to solve the vanishing mystery when the residents of Griffin Rock start disappearing.
Ghosts haunt and terrorize the residents of Griffin Rock.

The kids are covertly planning a surprise birthday party for their father. Chief Burns tells them he is heading to the docks, but actually takes a trip to the bakery for a cake, as a present for his family, thinking that they forgot his birthday. Chase discovers this to be a lie and is confounded by this. While setting up the party back home, the kids and the other Rescue Bots realize that Chase and Chief Burns are missing, and search the entire town. Eventually they discover the two trapped inside an underground mine, and save them from the flooding water and falling rocks.

Seismic waves shake Griffin Rock, but they are artificial and caused by a reverberating loudspeaker hidden underground. Such loudspeaker is inadvertently connected remotely to Doc Greene's jukebox, where Doc Greene is practicing his dance moves. Meanwhile, Frankie creates a music video that includes footage of the Rescue Bots. Suspicious, she follows them into an underground tunnel during their mission to remove the loudspeaker inside, and attempts to converse with Heatwave. When the rocks are falling from the tunnel ceiling, Heatwave breaks from his "robot" character to save her, during which she finally learns of the Rescue Bot's secret.

Doc Greene invents a repulsor badge that allows the wearer to be occluded from projectiles. Cody uses it to participate more on the front lines, in missions with the rest of his family, against Chief Burns concern of his safety. His superhero status, however, is halted when his repulsor badge is overloaded and projects a nonstop field, enclosing him inside. Boulder uses neutralizing gloves, also invented by Doc Greene, to bypass the repulsive field and successfully remove the badge from Cody, shortly before it detonates.
When Doc Greene's experiment with a time machine goes awry, the Bots end up being captured by an old nemesis.
When the Bots return home, they find that Doctor Morocco is in command of Griffin Rock.
With the Rescue Bots' secret now known to Frankie and Doc, Cody has to deal with a new family dynamic as well as an unpredictable teleportation device.
Frankie's contest entry not only threatens her friendship with Cody and the Bots, but the safety of the entire island.
Experimental technology turns Cody into a grown-up, affecting his standing in the family and on the rescue team.
A mysterious iceberg off the coast of Griffin Rock brings both danger and the interest of an old nemesis.
As the Autobots adjust to new group dynamics within their expanded lineup, the Decepticons launch a new scheme to clone an army of beasts.
When the Bots and the Burnses fall into mysterious mind-controlled trances, Cody must find a way to wake them before he too is affected.
A reality show puts the Rescue Bot team in grave danger.
Cody and the Rescue Bots find a way to rescue Kade and Griffin Rock from gremlin nightmares.
Cody and the Rescue Bots hunt down a Godzilla-like beast.
Cody's Uncle Woodrow pays a visit, resulting in the entire Rescue Team (along with Optimus Prime) going on an unexpected mission below the surface of the earth.
Stuck underground and separated, the Rescue Bots and the Burnses, teamed with Optimus Prime, must regroup and work together to escape a primeval world of strange creatures.
When an experimental Space Elevator strands Doc and Graham in orbit, the Rescue Bots dust off their old ship and attempt a risky rescue.

An out-of-control mechanical bull leads Cody and the Rescue Bots on an adventure through the mysterious "Beam Box" (where Doc Greene is unsure who built it) to the Island of Misfit Technology, an island where dangerous technology is stored.
Griffin Rock is being taken over by a supercomputer.
Cody and the Rescue Bots battle an army of rattlesnakes.

Episode.EpisodeName: In Search of the Griffin's Nest
Episode.Overview: Cody and the Rescue Bots go on a quest to find the mythical Griffin's nest.
Chase goes rogue on an undercover mission as the Bots and Burns family do their best to save the island without using any modern technology.
Cody and the Bots find a stray dog who ends up joining the rescue team, but Priscilla Pynch has other plans for the pet.
Doctor Morocco learns a devastating secret that threatens the Rescue Bots' mission, but Optimus Prime guides Heatwave to acquire a surprising new ability.
The Rescue Team has to take action when rogue technology goes underground.
When Bumblebee partners up with Dani on a mission, Blades feels left out.
A mysterious superhero keeps a close eye on Griffin Rock while the Rescue Team rebuilds a train tunnel.
A plan is hatched by Griffin Rock's most evil villains to destroy the island and kidnap the Bots.
The Bots are made to believe the Burnses are their enemies after they're wiped of their memories.
Optimus is forced to embrace his primal side when the Rescue Bots discover an island of dinosaurs.
A notorious Big Game Hunter has set his sights on Optimus Prime's new Dinosaur Mode.
After Doc's imaging chamber produces several copies of Kade, each an extreme form of his personality, Cody and the Rescue Bots teach him a valuable lesson in teamwork.
The Rescue Bots and the Burns family board a ghost ship that appears only once every ten years.
Chase is determined to complete a space mission the Rescue Bots were forced to abandon before coming to Earth.
When Doc creates a giant dome to shield Griffin Rock from a hurricane, he inadvertently gives the Vigilant Computer a second chance to "protect" the island.
Doctor Morocco escapes and proves that even the smallest of pests can become an enormous threat to all of Griffin Rock.
An encounter with a space nebula causes the Rescue Bots to switch personalities with the Burns family members.
The Bots take on new job responsibilities when the worst winter storm in centuries threatens an important Griffin Rock holiday.
When Kade accidently ingests microscopic cleaning robots, the Rescue Bots must go on an inner space voyage to save him..
To rebuild his game-hunting business, Colonel Quarry tries to force Doc to build him more robotic dinosaurs. The result: Heatwave, Chase, and Blades must take on DinoBot forms.
While Charlie Burns is away at a Police Conference, Woodrow Burns returns to watch over the rest of the Burns Family.

Episode.EpisodeName: Did You See What I Thaw?
Episode.Overview: The Bots discover a caveman preserved in ice, but their attempts to help him adjust to modern life cause chaos in Griffin Rock.
When monsters from Kade's favorite movie materialize in Griffin Rock, it's up to the DinoBots to corral the Kaiju.
The Bots must contend with thieving miniature souvenir replicas of themselves.
Cody experiences Groundhog Day over and over again caused by a renovated clock tower.
Rescue Team is suspended when evidence arises that the Burnses are pirate descendants.
An old friend of Optimus arrives to train the Bots in ocean rescues.
Dr. Morocco's best friend, famous writer Jules Verne, travels through time to find him.
Rescue Bots find they have new recruits to train, but these newbies are hiding a dark secret.
It's up to Cody and the Rescue Bots to teach Blurr and Salvage everything they need to know before the new recruits put someone in danger.
New recruit Blurr deserts the Rescue Bots and takes off in their ship, the Sigma, while the rest of the Team deals with the effects of a solar flare that knocks out all the power in Griffin Rock.
Cyber-Dog Servo puts the Rescue Bots' undercover status in jeopardy.
Boulder's discovery of endangered woodpeckers on Griffin Rock causes the Bots to go to extremes to protect them -- especially when the Mayor sees a chance for more tourist dollars.
While Doc's magician sister visits Griffin Rock, an injured Chase keeps watch from the Command Center, where he uncovers mysteries both magical and real.

Episode.EpisodeName: I Have Heard the Robots Singing
Episode.Overview: Doc's new invention causes everyone in town to sing instead of talk, creating confusion and tension on the Team.
The Island of Griffin Rock vanishes from the ocean.
The Rescue Bots make the ultimate sacrifice to save Griffin Rock.
An alien attack forces the Rescue Bots to expose themselves to the citizens of Griffin Rock.
A GroundBridge malfunction splits the entire Rescue Bots team apart.
Frankie must deal with a new presence in her family: her new baby sister.
Quickshadow disrupts the leadership of the Rescue Bots team.
While playing a virtual reality game, Cody and the Rescue Bots team search for a way to save the real Griffin Rock from being destroyed.
Cody tries to deal with being left out while the Rescue Bots team are in a difficult position with a group of vacation resort investors.
On Halloween night, Evan and Myles kidnap Quickshadow and threaten to expose the secret of the Rescue Bots.
In order to save the Rescue Bots from danger, the Burns family turns to an old enemy.
Things get very complicated when Chase is elected as the new mayor of Griffin Rock.
During a Cybertronian holiday, the Rescue Bots take on their biggest challenge yet - a super-sized, overtired baby.
When Griffin Rock's communication tower needs replacing, the Bots and Burnses take on part-time jobs to raise the money.
The Rescue Team struggles with last minute preparations as they finally open the mainland Training Center.

Episode.EpisodeName: The More Things Stay the Same
Episode.Overview: The Rescue Team becomes trapped inside the Mainland Training Center with a glitching hologram while the center comes perilously close to being discovered by humans.
Blurr is torn between his desire to be a winning racecar and a working Rescue Bot; Dani helps Blurr find balance.
Chief helps Woodrow rescue gorillas from a volcanic eruption; his sons learn they are heirs to the throne of Griffin Rock.
While at Griffin Rock's Pizza Pi Festival, Doc's new super-yeast causes chaos and the Bots have to find an unconventional solution to the rising problem.
Bumblebee's appearance causes problems for the Rescue Bot team at the Bots' training center.
In order for Blades to participate in a Lad Pioneer leveling up ceremony on the mainland, Graham and Cody help disguise him - and discover surprises along the way.
The Rescue Team is drawn into the woods to solve the mystery of what's making the Griffin Spruces fall.
When a mysterious criminal and unexpected visitor arrive in Griffin Rock, Blurr's future as a Rescue Bot is challenged.
Energon and technology have fallen into treacherous hands and it is up to the Burns family and their Bots to steal them back.
Kade's idol, an arrogant movie star, comes to Griffin Rock in preparation for a role, causing trouble for the Rescue Team while they try to solve a series of mysterious break-ins.
When Dani's out-of-this-world test flight doesn't go according to plan, the Rescue Team strives to ensure she makes it back home.
While figuring out what kind of rescue worker he will become, Cody risks his own life to save a member of his family.
When Optimus Prime splits the Rescue Bots into different teams for new assignments, the evil genius of Doctor Morocco return to wreak havoc.
Doctor Morocco disguises himself in order to infiltrate the Rescue Bots and destroy them.
